item.title: New Members; Get started
item.description: Once you are familiar about Cubscouting, get started with onboarding process: 1. Register with BSA APPLY: Create account in scouting.org*. Apply to our Unit on BSA website Pay pack dues. GET APPROVED: Complete Youth Protection Training*. PARTICIPATE: Complete AB-506 VOLUNTEER PROCESS*. Complete LiveScan background check* Attend position specific training after talking to your assigned Den Leader Complete the Leader Onboarding Process. It sounds overwhelming, but most of it is a one-time activity and the content is very useful.

item.title: Pack dues
item.description: A part of cubscouting cost is pack dues. The pack dues are for buying the supplies, conducting den, pack events/activities, awards and recognitions, unit renewal cost, and anything that you observe as an operational expense during the den and pack meetings for the group in a scout calendar year. For this year (2024-2025), the dues are $75 per scout and $60 for every additional registered sibling in cubscout. Pack dues doesn’t cover the cost of camping and any major outdoor events that require campsite / event registration fee with third parities.

item.title: STEM: Pop rocket
item.description: The Alka-Seltzer pop rocket experiment is a fun and simple science activity that demonstrates principles of chemical reactions, gas production, and Newton’s Third Law of Motion. This experiment involves creating a small “rocket” using common household items: Alka-Seltzer tablets, water, and a film canister or similar container with a tight-fitting lid.

item.title: Training for adults
item.description: All registered adult leaders and the volunteering adults must complete YPT and maintain ACTIVE status through out the scouting.
